docs.lead_paragraph: HOOD ON HEALTH.--Take precious care of your precious health; but how, as the housewife says, to make it keep. Why, then, don't smokedry it, or pickle it in everlasting acids, like the Germans.
docs.snippet: HOOD ON HEALTH.--Take precious care of your precious health; but how, as the housewife says, to make it keep. Why, then, don't smokedry it, or pickle it in everlasting acids, like the Germans.

headline.main: TURKEY.; An Audience with the Sultan.

docs.lead_paragraph: As in all other countries, usage has established in the Ottoman Empire the necessary formality of presenting a newly accredited minister to the sovereign to whom he is represented.
docs.snippet: As in all other countries, usage has established in the Ottoman Empire the necessary formality of presenting a newly accredited minister to the sovereign to whom he is represented.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; SPORTING INTELLIGENCE. Suicide of a Young Lady. Board of Supervisors BILLS ORDERED TO BE PASSED. RESOLUTIONS ADOPTED. FROM THE COMPTROLLER. FROM THE COMPTROLLER. Prize Declamations at the Free Academy. Latest from the Steamer Franklin. The Homicide in Malberry-street. FATAL EFFECTS OF THE HEAT. ATTEMPT AT ASSASSINATION. FIRES. DEATH OF A CONVICT. FATAL INJURIES BY SHOOTING. RIFLE SHOOTING. MEMENTO MORI. NEW STEAMSHIP. COUNSEL TO THE SHERIFF.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Difficulty between Hyer and Morrissey--Rumored Prize Fight--Prompt Action of the Police. During the last few days of intense hot weather, the pugilists, TOM HYER and JOHN MOR RISSEY, became hot-blooded and considerably excited respecting the difficulty that has existed between them since the encounter with Yankee SULLIVAN.

headline.main: JAPAN.; Visit of the American Squadron--Habits of the People--Products of the Country, &c. From the New-York Observer.

docs.lead_paragraph: The squadron under Commodore PERRY'S command has been in this magnificent Bay since the 12th ult., and he or some of his suite have been in daily communication with the Japanese authorities since that time.
docs.snippet: The squadron under Commodore PERRY'S command has been in this magnificent Bay since the 12th ult., and he or some of his suite have been in daily communication with the Japanese authorities since that time.

headline.main: OUR RELATIONS WITH CHINA.; The American Commissioner and the Viceroy in 1853. Imporant Letter from Hon. Humphrey Marshall to the Secretary of State. INTERESTING ACCOUNT OF HIS INTERVIEW WITH THE VICEROY. VICEROY. CHINESE MANNERS AND CUSTOMS. Trade of the Interior of China. REPORTED FROM WASHINGTON, FROM OFFICIAL COPIES, EXCLUSIVELY FOR THE NEW-YORK DAILY TIMES.

docs.lead_paragraph: SIR: I informed you in my last dispatch, that after my messenger returned from Suehow, without seeing the Viceroy, I was induced to wait, to ascertain what would be the effect of a message from the Provincial Judge, before I proceeded to any uncivil measures. e, before I proceeded to any uncivil measures.

headline.main: Mr. Blunt's Illness--Letter from Mr. Romeyn.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Evening Post. In a communication from Mr. HENRY HULL of Lebanon Springs, to you, in last evening's paper, I perceive that a reference is made to me as to the nature of Mr. N. B. BLUNT'S illness.
docs.snippet: From the Evening Post. In a communication from Mr. HENRY HULL of Lebanon Springs, to you, in last evening's paper, I perceive that a reference is made to me as to the nature of Mr. N. B. BLUNT'S illness.

docs.lead_paragraph: THE CHOLERA IN BROOKLYN.--Fourteen new cases of Cholera, and one death, were reported to the Board of Health yesterday morning. The summary of deaths by Cholera for the week, will show an entirely different state of affairs from what is represented by the reports made by the Board of Health.
